results.title: Nirvana: Hina dolls
results.brief_description: Looks at the Hina Festival in Japan. Special dolls are displayed not as toys, but to symbolise the spirit of Japan and to embody the past experiences of the Japanese people.

results.title: Night wait
results.brief_description: A lonely cripple wanders through the streets at night seeking companionship. A girl at a bus stop makes conversation with him but when he makes further advances she, like the rest of society, rejects him. Cast includes Noela Fergusson and Vittorio Bianchi.

results.title: Night train [Widescreen]
results.creator_credit: John Lynch, Tristan Orpen Lynch, Coachouse Productions and Subotica Films
results.brief_description: Night train is a romantic drama by first time director John Lynch featuring Oscar nominees John Hurt (Elephant Man, 1984) as Michael Poole, an ex-con man, and Brenda Blethyn (Secrets and Lies, Saving Grace) as Alice, the landlady’s daughter. Upon release from prison, Michael Poole seeks refuge in an effort to avoid pursuit by a sinister gangland boss to whom he owes money. He moves into a house owned by an elderly domineering mother (Pauline Flanagan) and her emotionally repressed daughter, Alice. Poole finds his passion for electric model trains has Alice intrigued and together they find escape in his strange fantasy world. An awkward and tender romance begins to develop between these two rather sad and lonely people, frustrated by their pasts, and determined to find happiness in their future. But Poole is forced to take flight as the mob boss closes in, and with him Alice, on a real night train adventure on the Orient Express. Set in Dublin and filmed on location in Ireland, England and Italy, “Night train” has many delightful and touching moments performed by two great actors and a very capable supporting cast. Cast also includes Lorcan Cranitch, Cathy White, Peter Caffrey, Paul Roe and Rynagh O’Grady. (Awards: Winner Silver Rose Best Actor John Hurt, Schermi d’Amore Verona; Nominated Best European Film John Lynch, Brussels International Film Festival)

results.title: Nigeria's University College
results.creator_credit: Lionel Snazelle and Nigerian Film Unit
results.brief_description: This film follows the various stages in the building of the University College at Ibadan, in Nigeria, designed by Jane drew and Maxwell Fry, The British architects, who supervised the work on the spot.

results.title: Newsboy
results.brief_description: For the newsboys of Melbourne, dodging in and out of traffic and delivering newspapers is all part of the job. The promise of real adventure lies in a stolen trip down the Yarra River on a beautiful sunny day. Produced with the assistance of the Creative Development Branch of the Australian Film Commission.

results.title: News reports from France. [No. 77/145] = Chroniques de Franc
results.brief_description: Cinemagazine: 1. The kings of Notre Dame - Notre Dame defies the ages, yet through the years she has undergone numerous transformations. 2. The Veterinary - A portrait of a French country veterinary surgeon who cares for wild animals. 3. Erte - A survey of the work of set and costume designer Romain de Tietoff alias Erte. 4. The Nice International Summer Academy - An international summer school of art and music conducted in Nice by Fernand Oubradous.

results.title: News reports from France. [No. 72/83] = Chroniques de France
results.brief_description: Cinemagazine: 1. Regine Crespin - Began singing at 16, three years at Paris conservatory…the story of Regine Crespin. Includes some excerpts of arias sung by the diva. 2. The Dunkirk-Marseille Thruway - 1073 kilometers of thruway. 3. The stunt man - The work of stunt man Remy Julienne, or how all undue risk must be avoided because you cannot cheat. You must not cheat. 4. Louis Malle - Louis Malle, aged 39, has directed ten major films.
